politics:
1. Introduction
Fastorika Limited ('Company', 'we', 'us') respects your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains what data we collect, how we use it, and what rights users have.

2. The data we collect
Fastorika Limited collects the following categories of information/data:
2.1. Identification data – name, date of birth, passport data, customer IDs.  2.2. Contact data – address, phone number, email, social media accounts.  2.3. Payment and transaction information – partial card/bank account/payment system account data, transaction history.  2.4. Technical information – IP address, cookies, device information, log files.

3. How we use the data
Your data is processed exclusively for the following purposes:
3.1. Fulfillment of contractual obligations (transfer processing, verification, account maintenance).  3.2. Compliance with legal requirements (AML/KYC/CFT).  3.3. Ensuring service security and fraud prevention.  3.4. Sending informational messages (with opt-out option).  3.5. Use for marketing and promotion (only with opt-out option).

4. Transfer of data to third parties
We transfer data only in the following cases:
4.1. To payment providers and banks for transfer processing.  4.2. To government agencies if legally required.  4.3. To contractors providing technical infrastructure, KYC services, and anti-fraud systems.

5. Data retention periods
5.1. In accordance with 4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD and local laws, your data will be stored for at least 5 years and may be stored up to 10 years after the end of the business relationship.  5.2. If legislation requires longer storage (e.g., for investigations), the period may be extended.  5.3. After the retention period expires, data will be deleted or anonymized.

6. User rights (in accordance with GDPR)
You have the right:
6.1. Right of access – request a copy of your data.  6.2. Right to rectification – make changes or corrections to data.  6.3. Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten') – you can request data deletion, but if storage is required under AML/CFT, we must retain it for 5–10 years.  6.4. Right to restrict processing – suspend use of your data for certain purposes (e.g., marketing).  6.5. Right to data portability – receive a copy of your data in machine-readable format.  6.6. Right to object – opt out of processing for marketing or mailings.  6.7. Right to complain – contact the national data protection supervisory authority.

7. Contacts
For data processing issues:
·         Support: support@fastorika.com
·         Compliance | AML | KYC | CFT | DPO: compliance@fastorika.com

8. Conclusion
By using the Fastorika service, you confirm that you have read and agree to this Privacy Policy.
privacytitle: Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Policy (AML/CFT Policy)
termsTitle: Terms & Conditions of Fastorika Limited Service
terms:
Introduction
These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern access to and use of the website, software solutions, and other services provided by Fastorika Limited, registered under Belize law (registration number 000050785) ("Company" or "Fastorika").
By using the Fastorika website, software, or services, you ("User" or "Client") confirm that you have read these Terms, understand their content, and agree to comply with them in full.
If you do not agree with any provisions of these Terms, you must immediately stop using the site and Fastorika services.
This agreement is a public offer under Belize law and is legally binding from the moment you start using Fastorika services.

A. General Terms of Use
1. Right to use
By using the Fastorika site and services, you confirm that:
• You are at least 18 years old or the age of majority in your country of residence.
• You have full legal capacity to enter contracts and accept legal obligations.
• You use the service solely for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms.

Fastorika does not provide services to persons who:
• Reside in jurisdictions where such services are prohibited by law;
• Are under sanctions or restrictions from international organizations or state bodies;
• Act on behalf of third parties without proper authorization.

2. Modification of Terms
Fastorika reserves the right to change, supplement, or update these Terms at any time.
Changes take effect upon publication on the official Fastorika website (fastorika.com). Continued use after publication confirms consent to the new version. If you disagree, you must stop using Fastorika services.

3. Prohibited Activities
You agree not to use the Fastorika site, software, or services for illegal, fraudulent, or unauthorized activities, including but not limited to:
• Violation of Belize law, your country of residence, or international norms, including AML/CFT rules and sanctions.
• Providing false, incomplete, or misleading information during registration or use.
• Attempts to interfere with site operation, bypass security, or unauthorized access to data/accounts.
• Transmitting or distributing viruses, malicious code, programs, or scripts.
• Posting spam, ads, phishing links, or unwanted materials.
• Operations related to money laundering, terrorist financing, illegal trade, gambling, or other prohibited activities.
• Attempts to bypass identification, KYC, or transaction monitoring.
• Using the service on behalf of a third party without legal basis or power of attorney.
Fastorika may restrict, suspend, or terminate access upon detecting violations or suspicions of illegal activity.

4. Intellectual Property Rights
All materials on the website and in Fastorika services (texts, logos, trademarks, design, software, source code, databases, structure, interface) are the exclusive property of Fastorika Limited or used lawfully. You are granted a limited, non-transferable right to use the Content solely for lawful purposes within these Terms.

5. Service Availability
Fastorika strives to ensure stable platform operation but does not guarantee continuous availability or error-free performance. Access may be limited for maintenance, third-party issues, or force majeure. Fastorika is not liable for indirect losses from temporary unavailability. The company minimizes downtime and notifies users in advance where possible.

6. Use of Third-Party Services
Certain functions, including transfer processing, KYC, or currency exchange, may be handled by external licensed partners under their own terms and privacy policies. Fastorika is not responsible for third-party actions or failures. Interaction with third-party services is at your own risk.

B. Description and Nature of Services
1. Nature of Services
Fastorika provides access to an online platform for user interaction with external licensed financial providers. The service allows initiating transfer requests, tracking status, and receiving notifications/tools. Fastorika is a SaaS provider and does not accept, store, transfer, convert, or manage user funds. All financial operations are performed exclusively by licensed third parties.

2. No Licensed Financial Activity
Fastorika Limited operates in IT and is not a bank, e-money issuer, payment institution, investment, trust, or brokerage company, nor a provider for storing/managing client funds. Fastorika does not operate in Belize and does not serve Belize residents. Under Belize law (IFSC Act, IBC Act), such activities do not require licensing.

3. Commissions and Fees
Using Fastorika services may involve service fees for access/functions or request processing, shown before confirmation. Fastorika does not charge for fund transfers by third-party providers. Third-party fees are set independently and may be auto-deducted. Fastorika does not control or refund third-party fees.

4. Limits and Restrictions
Fastorika and partners may set limits (transaction amount, count per period, by country/currency/user category) for legal compliance, fraud prevention, and stability. Operations may be suspended/rejected if limits are exceeded or additional checks are needed.

5. Responsibility for Data Accuracy
You are fully responsible for the accuracy and timeliness of all data provided during registration/use. Fastorika and partners process based solely on your data and are not liable for delays/losses from incorrect info.

C. Refund Policy
Refunds are possible only if a transaction was not successfully executed/confirmed by the third-party provider. Fastorika is not responsible for refunds if the operation was technically completed and confirmed by the provider.
privacy:
1. Introduction
This Policy sets out the framework adopted by Fastorika Limited (“the Company”) to prevent its services from being used for money laundering (ML) or terrorist financing (TF) purposes. Fastorika Limited is committed to complying with international standards, including the FATF Recommendations, EU Anti-Money Laundering Directives (4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD), GDPR, and the relevant legislation of Belize and other jurisdictions in which the Company operates. The objective of this Policy is to establish clear standards and internal procedures for customer due diligence (CDD), enhanced due diligence (EDD), ongoing monitoring, record-keeping, and reporting of suspicious activities to the competent authorities.

2. Regulatory Framework
This Policy is based on the following legal and regulatory frameworks:
- Financial Action Task Force (FATF) 40 Recommendations
- EU Anti-Money Laundering Directives (4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD)
- GDPR (data protection obligations)
- Belize Anti-Money Laundering legislation
- Other local AML/CFT laws applicable to the jurisdictions where Fastorika operates

3. Scope

This Policy applies to all employees, directors, contractors, and partners of Fastorika Limited. It covers all services, transactions, and business activities of the Company, including IT solutions, platform services, and any financial integrations.
4. Risk-Based Approach

The Company adopts a risk-based approach to AML/CFT. Clients and transactions are classified into risk categories:
- Low Risk
- Medium Risk
- High Risk (e.g., PEPs, large transactions, offshore jurisdictions)

Risk factors include geographical risk, product risk, client type, and transaction nature.

5. Customer Due D diligence (CDD/KYC)
Fastorika Limited performs the following measures:
- Customer identification (full name, DOB, citizenship, address, document)
- Document authenticity verification
- Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) for high-risk clients
- Source of Funds (SoF) and Source of Wealth (SoW) verification
- Ongoing monitoring of client operations

6. Politically Exposed Persons (PEP)
The Company applies enhanced due diligence to all identified PEPs. Specialized databases and systems are used for detection.

7. Sanctions and Prohibited Activities
Fastorika Limited screens all clients against international sanctions lists (UN, EU, OFAC, UK). The Company does not accept clients from high-risk FATF jurisdictions or those involved in prohibited activities.
8. Transaction Monitoring

The Company monitors all transactions using automated and manual tools. Alerts are generated for suspicious operations, including structuring, smurfing, and other schemes (TBFC).
9. Reporting Suspicious Operations
Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR/STR) are submitted to competent authorities in Belize (FIU Belize) or the jurisdiction of operation. Reports are filed immediately upon detecting suspicious activity.

10. Data Storage
Client documents, transaction history, and KYC files are stored for at least 5 years after the end of business relations. In some cases, up to 10 years per legislation.

11. Employee Training
All Fastorika Limited employees must undergo annual AML training covering suspicious transaction identification, KYC procedures, and reporting duties.

12. Internal Control
Fastorika Limited appoints a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) responsible for AML compliance, regulator reporting, and internal process oversight.

13. Liability for Violations
Violations of this Policy result in disciplinary measures, up to termination of employment/cooperation, and reporting to authorities.
